The fact that Triton is orbitally doomed represents a unique set of options for him. 1st he is massively rich in Nitrogen and water. Carbon,Nitrogen, water and oxygen are super vital id you are terraforming planets or building rotating habitats. The massive rocky core of Triton will come in handy after we build a shellwords or even a ballon world all over Neptune. All that surface area (about 16 times that of earth) will need a layer of rock. And triton can easily provide the material since the rocky core of neptune is extremely hard to reach and mine. So in the end we will exchange a doomed moon for a super earth with 16  times the surface area. Not bad at all.

THE ADVENTURES OF TRITON AND HIS BROTHER

Once there was a double dwarf system. In that system was Triton and his brother. They went on awesome adventures in the solar system. But one day things were going to change. Neptune was getting closer to the sun and was following his friend, Uranus. "HEY YOU TWO! GET OUT OF THE WAY BEFORE MY GRAVITY MAKES YOU ORBIT ME OR THROW YOU OUT OF ORBIT!" said Neptune. Triton refused to get out of Neptune's way, and Triton's brother said "Triton, he's WAY bigger than us, maybe we should move." "NO BROTHER, THIS WILL BE ONE OF OUR GREATEST ADVENTURES, TAKING ON A PLANET!" Triton replied. It was too late. Neptune's gravity had affected the connection between Triton and his brother. "BROTHER! NO! Please Neptune! I beg you to release me!" "NOPE, YOU WILL ORBIT ME UNTIL YOU BECOME A RING SYSTEM AS BIG AS SATURN'S, OR UNTIL YOU CRASH INTO ME!" Neptune shouted at Triton. Triton's brother drifted away from the solar system and he was never heard from again.
A LONG LONG TIME LATER...
"Triton, do you remember your brother?" "Yes of course!" "I have some news." "What is it! TELL ME!!!" "HE AIN'T COMIN' BACK, TWERP!"
Meanwhile in interstellar space...
"Hello? Anybody there??" Triton's brother was so far away from the solar system and he found himself near Sirius.

The End!

+Kurzgesagt – In a Nutshell   I've heard in several places that a retrograde/backward orbit like Triton's causes the satellite to slow down. But what exactly is the cause of this decrease?

I know this information came out when the New Horizons Probe visited Pluto in 2015 (after this video was published) but we now know of 5 geologically active objects in the Solar System. Pluto (strangely enough!) is one of them!

(Evidence of this can be found here: http://www.zmescience.com/science/geology/pluto-geologically-active-2842342/)

A huge question surrounding Pluto now is this: Why? Given the age of the solar system Pluto should have radiated any latent heat that existed during the solar system's formation out by now. Something inside pluto is causing it to continue being geologically active. Question is: what is it?
